intro: Thesium urceolatum, commonly known as the bladderleaf thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Thesium urceolatum is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions.
